SimpleDate.description: A single point in time. If a duration is expressed as a SimpleDate it is defining a period of time without a designated Start or End date.

HistoricalDate.description: A simple date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

StartDate.description: Start of a date range. If there is a start date with no end date provided, this implies that the end date is unknown but that the date being recorded is not just a simple date but a range of unknown duration.

HistoricalStartDate.description: A start date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

EndDate.description: End of a date range with a known start date.

HistoricalEndDate.description: An end date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

Cycle.description: Use to indicate occurrence of this range within a series of ranges as an integer identifying the cycle, i.e. the 4th wave of a data collection cycle would have 4.

Reason.description: The reason for the access restriction. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

User.description: The user group to whom the restriction applies. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

TypeOfAccess.description: The type of data access condition. The use of a controlled vocabulary is strongly recommended.

AccessTypeName.description: A name by which the description of access is known. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example, different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the description of access. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the access description. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ConfidentialityStatement.description: A statement regarding the confidentiality of the related data or metadata. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

AccessPermission.description: A link to a form used to provide access to the data or metadata including a statement of the purpose of the form.

Restrictions.description: A statement regarding restrictions to access. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

CitationRequirement.description: A statement regarding the citation requirement. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DepositRequirement.description: A statement of deposit requirements for the data.  Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

AccessConditions.description: Conditions for access to the metadata and/or data.  Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Disclaimer.description: A disclaimer regarding the liability of the data producers or providers. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

AccessRestrictionDate.description: The date or date range of the access restriction for all or portions of the data. Includes a reason for the access restriction as well as the user group to which the restriction applies.

ContactOrganizationReference.description: A reference to an organization or individual to contact for further information regarding the metadata or data.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

TypeOfActionToMinimizeLosses.description: A brief textual description of the action taken to minimize loss of data. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary

Description.description: Full description of the action taken to minimize loss of data. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

RegionOfAction.description: Identifies the region of the object where the action needs to occur based on the object type by specifying a segment of the object.

Description.description: Describes the specific actions that should take place. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

RegExp.description: Allows for the provision of a regular expression to describe a mark (such as a specific letter or number).

TypeOfAdditionalData.description: Specifies type of additional data collected. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: Description of the additional data collected. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Content.description: Supports the optional use of XHTML formatting tags within the string structure. In addition to the language designation and information regarding translation, the attribute isPlain can be set to true to indicate that the content should be treated as plain unstructured text, including any XHTML formatting tags. Repeat the content element to provide multiple language versions of the same content.

EffectivePeriod.description: Clarifies when the identification information is accurate.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

TypeOfAddress.description: Indicates address type (i.e. home, office, mailing, etc.). The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (TypeOfAddress) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

Line.description: Number and street including office or suite number. May use multiple lines.

CityPlaceLocal.description: City, Place, or local area used as part of an address.

StateProvince.description: A major subnational division such as a state or province used to identify a major region within an address.

GeographicPoint.description: Geographic coordinate point for the location

TimeZone.description: Time zone of the location expressed as code. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (TimeZone) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

EffectivePeriod.description: Clarifies when the identification information is accurate.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

IsPreferred.description: Set to "true" if this is the preferred location for contacting the organization or individual.

IndependentDimension.description: The rank of a dimension that acts as the denominator (independent variable).

DependentDimension.description: The rank of a dimension that acts as the numerator (dependent variable).

IsNCubeUniverse.description: When true indicates that total count of the NCube as described by the universe acts as the independent variable (denominator) and that all dimensions are used to define the dependent variable (numerator). When false, use the IndependentDimension and DependentDimension elements to assign each rank to its appropriate role.

AggregationMethod.description: Identification of the type of aggregation method used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary. DDI strongly recommends the use of a controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (AggregationMethod) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

AggregationVariables.description: Identifies the independent and dependent variables used in the aggregation process in-line.

AggregationVariablesReference.description: A reference to an existing AggregationVariables description.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

IndependentVariableReference.description: A reference to a variable, which is an important constraint for the computed aggregation measure and has the potential to invoke a change in a dependent variable like sex for average of income. In the context of calculating percentages, the use of Sex as the independent variable would indicate that the percentages provided represent the percentage of the dependent variable associated with a specific value for Sex (i.e., the dependent variable expressed as a percentage of the total for Males). This would be opposed to the percent for the full population (the percent of the total grid population falling within that particular cell).

DependentVariableReference.description: A reference to a variable, for which the aggregate measure is computed like average of income.

CategoryReference.description: A reference to the category containing the label for the anchor point.

Value_string.description: The value of the anchor point.

SamplingStageReference.description: References the sample plan stage in an overall sample plan. TypeOfObject should be set to SamplingStage

SampleFrameReference.description: Reference to sample frame used. Note that this is the actual sample frame used and may differ from the recommended sample frame found in the sample plan stage referenced for this procedure. Deviation from the recommended sample frame should be described in FrameLimitations.

FrameLimitations.description: Description of limitations of the usage of the frame for the data collection.  Clarify (over/under) coverage issues, lack of needed fields, and needs to support over-sampling or deviation from recommended sample frame found in sample plan stage.

TargetSampleSize.description: The desired sample size for this particular sample plan express in relation to its strata number if relevant. Provides means of expressing the formula used for determining the sample size.

DateOfSample.description: Date or date range when sample was drawn.

ResponsibleForSamplingReference.description: A reference to an organization or individual responsible for sampling.

ArchiveOrganizationReference.description: A reference to the organization or an individual acting as the archive.

Item.description: Describes individual items held or distributed by the archive in connection with a study, group of studies, or resource packages. What constitutes an item is determined by the archive.

Collection.description: Describes a collection of items held or distributed by the archive in connection with a study, group of studies, or resource packages. What constitutes an collection is determined by the archive.

DefaultAccess.description: Describes access to the archive in general. The restrictions noted at this level apply to all holdings of the archive unless overridden for specified collections or items.

FundingInformation.description: Describes funding information in relationship to the archive and its activities. This may be archive wide or related to specific collections or projects within the archive.

Budget.description: This describes the archive budget. It can be repeated for distinct budget activities such as budget periods, specific projects or types of activity.

QualityStatementReference.description: A reference to a Quality Statement regarding the activities and operation of the archive. These may include access or preservation appraisal assessments or certification.

Coverage.description: Documents the spatial, temporal, and/or topical coverage of the archive or division of an archive.

TypeOfArea.description: Specify the type of area covered i.e. Total, Land, Water, etc. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, Square Kilometer, Square Mile. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

AreaMeasure.description: The area measure expressed as a decimal for the measurement unit designated.

AttributeReference.description: Reference to the attribute described in an NCube.

Value.description: Contains the value for the attribute.

AttributeReference.description: Reference to the attribute described in an NCube.

PhysicalTableLocation.description: Description of the physical location of the attribute value in the data file.

Value.description: Contains the value for the attribute.

AttributeReference.description: Reference to the attribute described in an NCube.

PhysicalLocation.description: Description of the physical location of the attribute value in the data file.

Value.description: Contains the value for the attribute.

InterviewerInstructionReference.description: Reference to an interviewer instruction expressed as DDI XML.

InterviewerInstructionAttachmentLocation.description: Allows attachment of an instruction to a specific item in a question structure. For example, to a Label, QuestionText, ResponseDomain, Response domain value, or grid cell.

IsDisplayed.description: If set to true the content of the instruction is intended to be displayed. If set to false the preference is for the instruction to be displayed upon request if this is supported by the mode of presentation.

CodeReference.description: Identifies the value to which the new response domain is attached by a references a specific Code within the CodeDomain.

CategoryReference.description: Identifies the value to which the new response domain is attached by a references a specific Category within the CategoryDomain.

DomainSpecificValue.description: Identifies the value to which the new response domain is attached by a reference to a specific value used by the response domain and the specific value.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

VariableReference.description: A reference to a variable that describes the attribute.

AttachmentValue.description: The value of the attachment expressed as a string, if not a variable.

AttachmentRegionReference.description: Reference to the CoordinateRegion that defines the attachment point for the attribute.

MeasureDefinitionReference.description: Reference to the MeasureDefinition that the attribute is attached to.

Value.description: Reference to the specified Value of the MeasureDefinition that the attribute is attached to.

AttachmentLevel.description: Describes the attachment level of the attribute as Cube, CoordinateRegion, Dimension, Measurement, or MeasurementValue.

TypeOfAudioClip.description: The type of audio clip provided. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

AudioClipBegin.description: The point to begin the audio clip. If no point is provided the assumption is that the start point is the beginning of the clip provided.

AudioClipEnd.description: The point to end the audio clip. If no point is provided the assumption is that the end point is the end of the clip provided.

AuthorizingAgencyReference.description: References the authorizing agency, organization, or individual.

StatementOfAuthorization.description: Text of the authorization. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

LegalMandate.description: Provide a legal citation to a law authorizing the study/data collection. For example, a legal citation for a law authorizing a country's census.

OtherMaterialReference.description: Inline description and link to the policy using the DDI Other Material structure.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

OtherMaterialReference.description: A description of the authorization source using OtherMaterial. The TypeOfOtherMaterial should state AuthorizationSource. An authorization source should differentiate between codes derived for different purposes within the same agency.

IdentifierParsingInformation.description: Provides structural information for parsing the identification code structure of the Authorized Source into its separate parts.

BasedOnReference.description: A reference to an object upon which the current object is based using a standard Reference structure. Repeat for multiple base objects. The TypeOfObject may be any Versionable or Maintainable object.

BasedOnRationaleDescription.description: Textual description of the rationale/purpose for the based on reference to inform users as to the extent and implication of the version change. May be expressed in multiple languages.

BasedOnRationaleCode.description: RationaleCode is primarily for internal processing flags within an organization or system. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

Increment.description: The size of the increment in units (number of characters, length, number of units).

StartValue.description: The starting value or beginning point of the increment string.

EndValue.description: The ending value or end point of the increment string.

String.description: A non-formatted string of text with an attribute that designates the language of the text. Repeat this object to express the same content in another language.

Affiliation.description: The affiliation of this person to an organization. This is generally an organization or sub-organization name and should be related to the specific role within which the individual is being listed.

SourceParameterReference.description: A structure used to bind the content of a parameter declared as the source to a parameter declared as the target. For example, binding the output of a question to the input of a generation instruction. Question A has an OutParameter X. Generation Instruction has an InParameter Y used in the recode instruction. Binding defines the content of InParameter Y to be whatever is provided by OutParameter X for use in the calculation of the recode.

TargetParameterReference.description: A structure used to bind the content of a parameter declared as the source to a parameter declared as the target. For example, binding the output of a question to the input of a generation instruction. Question A has an OutParameter X. Generation Instruction has an InParameter Y used in the recode instruction. Binding defines the content of InParameter Y to be whatever is provided by OutParameter X for use in the calculation of the recode.

WestLongitude.description: West longitude of the bounding box. (xmin)

EastLongitude.description: East longitude of the bounding box. (xmax)

SouthLatitude.description: South latitude of the bounding box. (ymin)

NorthLatitude.description: North latitude of the bounding box. (ymax)

OtherMaterialReference.description: Description and link to the BudgetDocument using the DDI Other Material structure.

Description.description: A description of the overall budget of the project. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

BudgetDocument.description: References to one or more external budget documents.

FixedIdentifier.description: Reference to the variable containing the unique identifier. This may be a concatenated variable which indicates the combination of variable required to create a unique identification. If more than one variable reference is included the combination of the variable field contents must be unique and all variables are required for case identification.

ConditionalIdentifier.description: Describes the information needed to identify a specific record or case within a record type. Repeating the field allows multiple means of identifying a case referencing multiple variables.

IsPrimary.description: Indicates whether the case identifier is the primary key.

CaseLawName.description: Case Law Name. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Description.description: A description of the case law. Supports the use of multiple languages and structured content.

CaseLawDate.description: Date of the case law ruling.

ConditionalVariableReference.description: References the variable containing the conditional content, provides the value of the condition.

ConditionalVariableValue.description: Use to specify the value of variable for which this is a case specification (i.e., GeoLevel in the example for Case Specification).

VariableReference.description: The variables required to provide a unique identification when the conditional variable contains the stated value.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

CategorySchemeReference.description: A reference to a CategoryScheme containing the required categories using the SchemeReference structure. Use Exclude in the SchemeReference to designate any categories NOT to include in this representation.

Label.description: A display label for the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

OutParameter.description: Allows for the response to be bound to one of the QuestionItem's OutParameters, so the collected information can be used elsewhere, for example as inputs to subsequent questions in an Instrument or to a GenerationInstruction. If multiple responses are possible, this would represent and ordered array of the responses.

ResponseCardinality.description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this response domain.

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

CategorySchemeReference.description: A reference to a CategoryScheme containing the required categories using the SchemeReference structure. Use Exclude in the SchemeReference to designate any categories NOT to include in this representation.

TypeOfCategoryStatistic.description: Type of category statistic. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary. DDI strongly recommends the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Statistic.description: The value (expressed as a decimal) of the statistics and whether it is weighted and/or includes missing values.

StatisticDouble.description: The value (expressed as a double) of the statistics and whether it is weighted and/or includes missing values.

CodeReference.description: A reference to the coded value of the category as used by a CodeRepresentation.

SelectDimension.description: For each dimension in the grid define the applicable values as "all values", a "specific value" or a range. If a rangeMinimum or rangeMaximum is provided without the other, the assumption is unbounded for the object not included.

Content.description: Supports the optional use of XHTML formatting tags within the string structure. In addition to the language designation and information regarding translation, the attribute isPlain can be set to true to indicate that the content should be treated as plain unstructured text, including any XHTML formatting tags. Repeat the content element to provide multiple language versions of the same content.

TypeOfLabel.description: A brief description of the label type. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

LocationVariant.description: Indicate if the content is intended to be used in a specific location. For example if the Label is specific to use within a sub-region of a country that uses the same language but may have unique terminology. For example some regions of the United States use the term "water fountain" and others use "bubbler".

ValidForStartDate.description: Allows for the specification of a starting date for the period that this label is valid. The date must be formatted according to ISO 8601.

ValidForEndDate.description: Allows for the specification of a ending date for the period that this label is valid. The date must be formatted according to ISO 8601.

MaxLength.description: A positive integer indicating the maximum number of characters in the label.

GridAttachment.description: Identifies the cell or cells in a grid to which the label is attached by a reference to a specific cell coordinate in a grid or by identifying a range of values along a dimension.

StartCharOffset.description: Number of characters from beginning of the document, indicating the inclusive start of the text range.

EndCharOffset.description: Number of characters from the beginning of the document, indicating the inclusive end of the text segment.

Title.description: Full authoritative title. List any additional titles for this item as AlternativeTitle.

AlternateTitle.description: An alternative title by which a data collection is commonly referred, or an abbreviation  for the title.

Creator.description: Person, corporate body, or agency responsible for the substantive and intellectual content of the described object.

Publisher.description: Person or organization responsible for making the resource available in its present form.

Contributor.description: The name of a contributing author or creator, who worked in support of the primary creator given above.

Language.description: Language of the intellectual content of the described object. Strongly recommend the use of language codes supported by xs:language which include the 2 and 3 character and extended structures defined by RFC4646 or its successors.

InternationalIdentifier.description: An identifier whose scope of uniqueness is broader than the local archive. Common forms of an international identifier are ISBN, ISSN, DOI or similar designator.

DublinCoreAbstract.description: A summary of the content of the resource.

DublinCoreAccessRights.description: Information about who can access the resource or its content.

DublinCoreAccrualMethod.description: The method by which items are added to a collection.

DublinCoreAccrualPeriodicity.description: The frequency at which items are added to a collection.

DublinCoreAccrualPolicy.description: The policy governing the addition of items to a collection.

DublinCoreAlternative.description: An alternative name for the resource.

DublinCoreAudience.description: A group of users for whom the resource is intended.

DublinCoreAvailable.description: The date the resource became or will become available.

DublinCoreBibliographicCitation.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource.

DublinCoreConformsTo.description: A reference to a standard to which the resource conforms.

DublinCoreContributor.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the resource.

DublinCoreCoverage.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource.

DublinCoreCreated.description: The date the resource was created.

DublinCoreCreator.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

DublinCoreDate.description: A point or period of time associated with the resource.

DublinCoreDateAccepted.description: The date the resource was accepted.

DublinCoreDateCopyrighted.description: The date the resource was copyrighted.

DublinCoreDateSubmitted.description: The date the resource was submitted.

DublinCoreEducationLevel.description: The level of education audience the resource is intended for.

DublinCoreExtent.description: The size or duration of the resource.

DublinCoreFormat.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

DublinCoreHasFormat.description: A related resource that is a format of the resource.

DublinCoreHasPart.description: A related resource that is a part of the resource.

DublinCoreHasVersion.description: A related resource that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the resource.

DublinCoreIdentifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource.

DublinCoreInstructionalMethod.description: The method of learning provided by the resource.

DublinCoreIsFormatOf.description: A related resource that is a format of the resource.

DublinCoreIsPartOf.description: A related resource in which the described resource is a part.

DublinCoreIsReferencedBy.description: A related resource that references the resource.

DublinCoreIsReplacedBy.description: A related resource that supplants or displaces the resource.

DublinCoreIsRequiredBy.description: A related resource that requires the resource.

DublinCoreIsVersionOf.description: A related resource that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the resource.

DublinCoreIssued.description: The date the resource was issued.

DublinCoreLicense.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

DublinCoreMediator.description: An entity that mediates access to the resource.

DublinCoreMedium.description: The material or physical carrier of the resource.

DublinCoreModified.description: The date the resource was last modified.

DublinCoreProvenance.description: A statement of any changes in ownership and custody of the resource.

DublinCorePublisher.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.

DublinCoreReferences.description: A related resource that is referenced by the resource.

DublinCoreReplaces.description: A related resource that is supplanted or displaced by the resource.

DublinCoreRequires.description: A related resource that is required by the resource.

DublinCoreRights.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

DublinCoreRightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

DublinCoreSource.description: A related resource from which the present resource is derived.

DublinCoreSpatial.description: The spatial characteristics of the resource.

DublinCoreTableOfContents.description: A list of subunits of the resource.

DublinCoreTemporal.description: The temporal characteristics of the resource.

DublinCoreTitle.description: The name given to the resource.

DublinCoreType.description: The nature or genre of the resource.

DublinCoreValid.description: The date the resource will be or was valid.

EntryText.description: Text describing the type of object/unit or object property. Supports the use of multiple languages.

CodesClassificationItemReference.description: The Classification Item with which the Classification Index Entry is associated. TypeOfObject should be set to ClassificationItem.

ValidFrom.description: Date from which the Classification Index Entry became valid. The date must be defined if the Classification Index Entry belongs to a floating Classification Index.

ValidTo.description: Date at which the Classification Index Entry became invalid. The date must be defined if the Classification Index Entry belongs to a floating Classification Index and is no longer valid.

CodingInstructions.description: Additional information which drives the coding process. Required when coding is dependent upon one or many other factors. Supports the use of multiple languages and structured content.

SourceClassificationItemReference.description: The source item refers to the Classification Item in the source Statistical Classification. TypeOfObject should be set to ClassificationItem.

TargetClassificationItemReference.description: The target item refers to the Classification Item in the target Statistical Classification. TypeOfObject should be set to ClassificationItem.

IsComplete.description: Specifies whether the relationship between the two Classification Items is partial or complete.

ValidFrom.description: Date from which the Map became valid. The date must be defined if the Map belongs to a floating Correspondence Table.

ValidTo.description: Date at which the Map became invalid. The date must be defined if the Map belongs to a floating Correspondence Table and is no longer valid.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

CodeListReference.description: A reference to the CodeList included in this representation using the Reference structure.

StatisticalClassificationReference.description: A reference to the StatisticalClassification included in this representation using the Reference structure.

CodeSubsetInformation.description: Allows further specification of the codes to use from the CodeList by defining the level or only the most discrete codes of a hierarchical CodeList, the range of codes to use, or an itemized sub-set.

Label.description: A display label for the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

OutParameter.description: Allows for the response to be bound to one of the QuestionItem's OutParameters, so the collected information can be used elsewhere, for example as inputs to subsequent questions in an Instrument or to a GenerationInstruction. If multiple responses are possible, this would represent and ordered array of the responses.

ResponseCardinality.description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this response domain.

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

DisplayCode.description: If set to "true" (default value) the code value associated with the category label will be displayed. Set to "false" if only the category label should not be displayed.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

CodeListReference.description: A reference to the CodeList included in this representation using the Reference structure.

StatisticalClassificationReference.description: A reference to the StatisticalClassification included in this representation using the Reference structure.

CodeSubsetInformation.description: Allows further specification of the codes to use from the CodeList by defining the level or only the most discrete codes of a hierarchical CodeList, the range of codes to use, or an itemized sub-set.

IncludedLevel.description: Identifies the specific level to include using the levelNumber. Repeat if more than one level is included.

IncludedCode.description: Specifies the codes to include in the representation.

DataExistence.description: Use when only the lowest, most discrete codes in the CodeList will be expressed as valid values. Identifies those levels of a CodeList with a regular hierarchy or those indicates discrete codes within an irregular hierarchy. All other codes will be used as labels within the hierarchy to clearly express content, but will not be valid as a response or representation value.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

CategoryReference.description: Reference to the category that the code value represents.

Value.description: The value of the code. In a microdata file this would be the value found in the data file. If used as the description of an NCube dimension the value provides the coordinate value for that dimension. Note that r:Value has an attribute xml:space with the default value of "default". If white space is critical to the understanding of this code value (such as critical leading or tailing spaces, or multiple spaces within the code) change the value of xml:space to "preserve".

IsDiscrete.description: Indicates whether the code is discrete (that is, placed at the lowest level in a hierarchy and has no children).

IsComprehensive.description: Used in hierarchical structures at upper level values to indicate whether or not the subelements of the code are comprehensive in coverage. Not applicable if attribute isDiscrete is set to "true".

IsTotal.description: This expresses a total whether or not isComprehensive is true. If isComprehensive = "true" then if addition is supported by the measure type, the contained categories can be aggregated to calculate the total. If isComprehensive = "false" or "unknown" the content of this field cannot be calculated if the value is not provided in the data.

StringValue.description: The code term as it appears in the controlled vocabulary

OtherValue.description: If the value of the string is "Other" or the equivalent from the controlled vocabulary, this attribute can provide a more specific value not found in the controlled vocabulary.

ControlledVocabularyCodeListReference.description: A DDI CodeList representation of the controlled vocabulary that the content was taken from.

ControlledVocabularyURI.description: Specifies the URI location for the full controlled vocabulary, usually represented in an RDF SKOS or XKOS representation.

ControlledVocabularyInstanceURI.description: Specifies the identification URI of the term/code within the controlled vocabulary if available.

CategoryReference.description: Reference to the Category represented by the Value of the Code assigned in a CodeList. Repeat for including multiple values.

CodeReference.description: Reference to the Code within the CodeList used by the variable describing the dimension. Repeat for including multiple values.

Range.description: Use when multiple values are included. This uses the unique Value provided for the Code as a means of identification. Provides the range of Values for this dimension that are within the area being defined. Repeat for non-contiguous values.

Rank.description: Identify the dimension being described by its rank value within the NCube description.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

CollectionEventName.description: A name for the Collection Event. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the Collection Event. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the Collection Event. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DataCollectorOrganizationReference.description: Reference to an organization or individual, defined in the organization scheme, responsible for the data collection.

DataSource.description: Describes a source of the data.

DataCollectionDate.description: Provides a date or range of dates for the described data collection event as well as  a cycle number when the collection is part of a series of data collection events.

DataCollectionFrequency.description: Documents the intended frequency of data collection, for example monthly, yearly, weekly, etc., preferably using an optional controlled vocabulary in the IntendedFrequency element. Date of first collection should be provided in StartDate as a basis for defining periodicity. EndDate should be entered for data collection cycles with a known or anticipated end date. EndDate is omitted in data collection series that are intended to be on-going.

ModeOfCollection.description: Describes the mode of data collection.

InstrumentReference.description: References the instrument or instruments used during the process of collecting data for this collection event period.

CollectionSituation.description: Describes the situation in which the data collection event takes place. If a number of collection situation types occurred repeat this element.

ActionToMinimizeLosses.description: Describes action taken to minimize loss of data from the collection event.

QualityStatementReference.description: A reference to a Quality Statement pertaining to the quality of the study methodology, metadata, or data to which it is associated. Quality statements may be related to external quality standards.

SampleReference.description: References the Sample used by this CollectionEvent. TypeOfObject should be Sample.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

TypeOfCollectionSituation.description: Allows brief identification of collection situation with the option of using a controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: Full description of the collection situation. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Citation.description: A citation for the collection. May additionally be rendered in native qualified Dublin Core (dc and dcterms).

LocationInArchive.description: Describes the location of the collection within the archive. Repeat for multiple locations such as separate stores for access and archival copies.

CallNumber.description: The name, code, or number used by the archive to uniquely identify the collection within the archive.

URI.description: The URL or URN for the collection.

ItemQuantity.description: The number of items in the collection. This is a check sum and should be updated as the contents of the collection changes. The use of this element is best restricted to completed collections where change in the number of objects is not dynamic.

StudyClass.description: An archive specific classification for the collection. This may be a topical classification, a classification of intended processing levels, or information on the processing status.

DefaultAccess.description: Default access restriction information applying to all of the items in the collection.

OriginalArchiveOrganizationReference.description: The original archive for the described collection, expressed as a reference to an organization listed in the organization scheme.

AvailabilityStatus.description: A statement of availability for the object. This is a positive statement (as opposed to access restrictions) which may be used for publication or other purposes. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DataFileQuantity.description: The number of data files in the described collection, expressed as an integer. This is a check sum and should be updated as the contents of the collection changes. The use of this element is best restricted to completed collections where change in the number of objects is not dynamic.

CollectionCompleteness.description: Describes the completeness of the collection for the item and its related data files and sub-items. Note coverage gaps as well as unique content . This statement may be used for publication or other purposes. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Item.description: Allows for the nesting of Item descriptions with a collection.

Collection.description: Allows for the nesting of collection descriptions with a collection hierarchical groupings within a collection description.

Description.description: A description of the purpose and use of the command code provided. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Command.description: This is an in-line provision of the command itself.

CommandFile.description: Identifies and provides a link to an external copy of the command, for example, a SAS Command Code script.

StructuredCommand.description: The is an extension stub to allow for the insertion of command code using an external namespace.

ProgramLanguage.description: Designates the programming language used for the command. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

InParameter.description: Describes the information used by the command as it is identified within the command structure. Use of the Alias may be needed to tie the designated input parameter content to its use in the external command file.

OutParameter.description: Describes the information that results from the command that may be used as input by another object. Use of the Alias may be needed to tie the designated output parameter content to its use in the external command file.

Binding.description: Defines the link between the output of an external object to an InParameter described above.

Location.description: A description of the location of the file. This may not be machine actionable. It supports a description expressed in multiple languages.

URI.description: The URL or URN of the command file.

ProgramLanguage.description: Designates the programming language used for the command. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

InParameter.description: Describes the information used by the command as it is identified within the command structure.

OutParameter.description: Describes the information that results from the command that may be used as input by another object.

Binding.description: Defines the link between the output of an external object to an InParameter described above.

CommandContent.description: Content of the command itself expressed in the language designated in Programming Language.

ComplianceConceptReference.description: A reference to a concept which relates to an area of coverage of the standard.

ExternalComplianceCode.description: Specification of a code which relates to an area of coverage of the standard. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

ComplianceRequirements.description: Specifies what is required to be seen as in compliance with the Standard. Note minimum requirements for various levels of compliance.

ComplianceConceptReference.description: A reference to a concept which relates to an area of coverage of the standard.

ExternalComplianceCode.description: Specification of a code which relates to an area of coverage of the standard. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

ComplianceDescription.description: Describe the measures taken to comply with the standards and/or specific levels of compliance by providing further details or a general description of compliance with the standard.

VariableReference.description: Identifies the variables whose values are concatenated to form the concatenated variable. Note that the order of these variables determines the order of concatenation.

CaseSpecification.description: Case specification allows different unique identifiers to be used based on the value of an identified variable. In some cases the value of a variable (such as a geographic level) results in a different set of variables required to identify a unique case. Case specification is used to capture these combinations. For example: a file containing State, County, and Place records. The unique identifier for a State requires a combination of GeoLevel=State and the variable STATE. Place would require a combination of GeoLevel=Place and the variables STATE and PLACE.

Text.description: The value of the static text string to use if condition is true. Supports the optional use of XHTML formatting tags within the string structure. If the content of a literal text contains more than one language, i.e. "What is your understanding of the German word 'Gesundheit'?", the foreign language element should be placed in a separate LiteralText component with the appropriate xml:lang value and, in this case, isTranslatable set to "false". If the existence of white space is critical to the understanding of the content (such as inclusion of a leading or trailing white space), set the attribute of Text xml:space to "preserve".

SourceParameterReference.description: This allows for the simple insert of a piece of information from another specified parameter. For example, if the text of the item using conditional text included the respondent’s name use SourceParameterReference to reference the InParameter of the question that is bound to the OutParameter of the question: "What is your name?"

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the text segment. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Expression.description: The condition on which the associated text varies expressed by a command code. For example, a command that inserts an age by calculating the difference between today’s date and a previously defined date of birth. Use InParameter and OutParameter of parent class to associate Parameters to Alias values in command code.

IfThenElseText.description: The condition on which the associated text varies expressed by an IfThenElse decision tree. For example, If MEMBER = 1, Then = [ConditionalResult singular], ElseIf MEMBER > 1, Then = [ConditionalResult plural].  Use InParameter and OutParameter of parent class to associate Parameters to Alias values in the IfCondition.

SourceParameterReference.description: This allows for the simple insert of a piece of information from another specified parameter. For example, if the text of the item using conditional text included the respondent’s name use SourceParameterReference to reference the InParameter of the question that is bound to the OutParameter of the question: "What is your name?"

LocationName.description: . May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Address.description: Location address identifying each part of the address as separate elements.

Email.description: Generic email address for the location

InstantMessaging.description: Instant Messaging identification for the location

RegionalCoverage.description: The geographic region for which this location operates. For example, the Kansas City office of the United States Bureau of the Census has responsibility for a region covering a number of states.

TypeOfLocation.description: Type of location e.g. home, primary office, alternate office etc.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

StringValue.description: The code term as it appears in the controlled vocabulary

OtherValue.description: If the value of the string is "Other" or the equivalent from the controlled vocabulary, this attribute can provide a more specific value not found in the controlled vocabulary.

ControlledVocabularyCodeListReference.description: A DDI CodeList representation of the controlled vocabulary that the content was taken from.

ControlledVocabularyURI.description: Specifies the URI location for the full controlled vocabulary, usually represented in an RDF SKOS or XKOS representation.

ControlledVocabularyInstanceURI.description: Specifies the identification URI of the term/code within the controlled vocabulary if available.

NumberOfUnits.description: The number of units to off-set the date for this item expressed as a decimal.

IsNegativeOffset.description: If set to "true" the date is offset the number of units specified PRIOR to the default date of the data. A setting of "false" indicates a date the specified number of units in the FUTURE from the default date of the data.

LinkingMap.description: Provides a link from a local object to a deposited object via reference and designates if the added material should Override, act as AddedContent, or DeleteContent in the original deposited material.

IsTranslated.description: Indicates whether content is a translation (true) or an original (false).

IsTranslatable.description: Indicates whether content is translatable (true) or not (false). An example of something that is not translatable would be a MNEMONIC of an object or a number.

TranslationSourceLanguage.description: List the language or language codes. The language original may or may not be provided in this bundle of language specific strings.

TranslationDate.description: The date the content was translated. Provision of translation date allows user to verify if translation was available during data collection or other time linked activity.

TextFormat.description: Specifies the format of the text content. Examples: text/plain is preferred, text/html, application/xhtml+xml, etc. see https://www.w3.org/2003/01/xhtml-mimetype/ for additional options. Example of vendor specific: text/vnd.example.markdown

Scope.description: Allows the provision of denoting of named section. Identification of a content sections would be the combination of language and scope, i.e. if more than one section is in English they must have different scope designations.

ContributorName.description: Full name of the contributor. Language equivalents should be expressed within the International String structure.

ContributorRole.description: The role of the contributor. Language equivalents should be expressed within the International String structure.

ContributorReference.description: Reference to a creator as described within a DDI Organization Scheme.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

MaxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed.

MinLength.description: The minimum number of characters allowed.

RegExp.description: A regular expression limiting the allowed characters or character order of the content.

Label.description: A display label for the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

OutParameter.description: Allows for the response to be bound to one of the QuestionItem's OutParameters, so the collected information can be used elsewhere, for example as inputs to subsequent questions in an Instrument or to a GenerationInstruction. If multiple responses are possible, this would represent and ordered array of the responses.

ResponseCardinality.description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this response domain.

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

MaxArray.description: The maximum number of coordinate pairs listed in the array. The two values in a coordinate pair are separated by a comma. Pairs in an array are separated by the character indicated in the arraySeparator attribute. Default value is "1".

ArraySeparator.description: The character used to separate arrays, if present. If not given a value, and if the maxArray attribute has a value greater than one, the separator is assumed to be whitespace.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

Label.description: A display label for the CoordinateRegion. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

UniverseReference.description: Reference to the universe statement containing a description of the persons or other elements that this CoordinateRegion refers to, and to which any analytic results refer. If more than one universe is referenced the universe of the CoordinateRegion is the intersect of the referenced universes. Use when the CoordinateRegion describes a subset of the NCube universe.

Description.description: A description of the content of the CoordinateRegion. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DimensionValue.description: Defines the included set of values needed to describe the coordinate region of the NCube on a Dimension by Dimension basis.

Commonality.description: Common features of the compared objects.  Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Difference.description: Description of the difference between the compared objects.  Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

CommonalityTypeCoded.description: A brief description describing the commonality of the two schemes/items, i.e., "Identical", "High", "Medium", "Low", "None". Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (CommonalityType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

CommonalityWeight.description: A value between 0 and 1 expressing the degree of commonality (0 indicates none, 1 indicates that they are identical).

UserDefinedCorrespondenceProperty.description: An alternate means of expressing commonality within a specific system. A system specific user defined correspondence expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

Budget.description: A description and/or reference to a related document providing budget information for the development activities

FundingInformation.description: Provides information about the agency and grant(s) which fund the development work.

StringValue.description: The code term as it appears in the controlled vocabulary

OtherValue.description: If the value of the string is "Other" or the equivalent from the controlled vocabulary, this attribute can provide a more specific value not found in the controlled vocabulary.

ControlledVocabularyCodeListReference.description: A DDI CodeList representation of the controlled vocabulary that the content was taken from.

ControlledVocabularyURI.description: Specifies the URI location for the full controlled vocabulary, usually represented in an RDF SKOS or XKOS representation.

ControlledVocabularyInstanceURI.description: Specifies the identification URI of the term/code within the controlled vocabulary if available.

EffectiveDate.description: If it is important to specify the date that this code is effective in order to accurately capture a name or similar change, specify that here. This can effect the actual geographic coverage or related name.

TopicalCoverageReference.description: Reference to a previously defined topical coverage.

TopicalCoverage.description: Description of the topical coverage of the data described in a particular DDI module.

SpatialCoverageReference.description: Reference to a previously defined spatial coverage.

SpatialCoverage.description: Description of the geographic coverage of the data described in a particular DDI module.

TemporalCoverageReference.description: Reference to a previously defined temporal coverage.

TemporalCoverage.description: Description of the temporal coverage of the data described in a particular DDI module.

RestrictionProcess.description: Allows for a specific machine actionable description of the restriction process using a GenerationInstructionReference, if one currently exists, or through a CommandCode. In the case of a physical instance, the RestrictionProcess would be the same as a case, record or variable selection process.

IsRestrictionOfParentCoverage.description: If the coverage described within this object is a restriction of the coverage of its parent study or group set this attribute to "true". If the coverage of a specific type (spatial, topical, or temporal) is not a restriction, include this coverage type by reference to that described in parent. Create a new coverage for the type being restricted.

Description.description: A description of the purpose and use of the command code provided. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Command.description: This is an in-line provision of the command itself.

CommandFile.description: Identifies and provides a link to an external copy of the command, for example, a SAS Command Code script.

StructuredCommand.description: The is an extension stub to allow for the insertion of command code using an external namespace.

Label.description: Label for the summary type used.

CreatorName.description: Full name of the creator and affiliation. Language equivalents should be expressed within the International String structure.

CreatorReference.description: Reference to a creator as described within a DDI Organization Scheme.

ResponseRate.description: A specific rate of response and/or a description of the rate of response for this event.
