RankingRange.description: The allowed values expressed using Range (allows for non-numeric values). In addition, defines the number of times a value may be used in expressing a ranking.

StaffClass.description: Specify the class of the staff participating in the activity. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

ParticipantRequirements.description: Describe any special or specific requirements for participating staff.

RecruitmentProcess.description: Describe the process to be used for staff recruitment in this class.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

RecordRelationshipName.description: A name for the RecordRelationship. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the RecordRelationship. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the RecordRelationship. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

SourceLogicalRecordReference.description: A reference to the Logical Record acting as the Source Record. All relationship information is from the source to the target. If the relationship is not unidirectional (i.e., sibling) simply assign one record as the source and the other as the target.

TargetLogicalRecordReference.description: A reference to the Logical Record acting as the Target Record.

SourceTargetLink.description: Each SourceTargetLink provides a pair of variables which act as all or part of a link between the source and the target records. Repeat if more than one set of variables is required to make the link.

RelationToTarget.description: Indicates the relationship of the source to the target. The value describes the role of the source in the relationship. This is a restricted list of Parent, Child, Sibling, Unknown.

VariableOrder.description: Provides the sequence of variables representing the order of storage within each record.

Record.description: For each record, contains the values for the items in order by the specified variable sequence.

SimpleDate.description: A single point in time. If a duration is expressed as a SimpleDate it is defining a period of time without a designated Start or End date.

HistoricalDate.description: A simple date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

StartDate.description: Start of a date range. If there is a start date with no end date provided, this implies that the end date is unknown but that the date being recorded is not just a simple date but a range of unknown duration.

HistoricalStartDate.description: A start date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

EndDate.description: End of a date range with a known start date.

HistoricalEndDate.description: An end date expressed in a historical date format, including a specification of the date format and calendar used.

Cycle.description: Use to indicate occurrence of this range within a series of ranges as an integer identifying the cycle, i.e. the 4th wave of a data collection cycle would have 4.

Subject.description: If the date is for a subset of data only such as a referent date for residence 5 years ago, use Subject to specify the coverage of the data this date applies to. May be repeated to reflect multiple subjects.

Type.description: Indicates value type as "GreaterThan", LessThan", "Equal", "GreaterThanOrEqual", "LessThanOrEqual", or "NotEqual".

ValueIsBlank.description: Set to "true" if the value of the conditional variable is blank.

RelatedToReference_IdentifiableType.description: Reference to the item within the DDI Instance to which this item is related.

RelatedToReference_Versionable.description: Reference to the item within the DDI Instance to which this item is related.

RelationshipDescription.description: A description of the nature of the relationship between the parent element of the relationship item and the DDI object to which it is related. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

TypeOfRelationship.description: Describes how the resource is related to the item. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

ResourcePackageReference.description: References a resource package used by the module.

TypeOfRequirementsAssessment.description: Identifies the type of requirement being assessed such as staffing, funding, source materials, etc. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: A description of the Requirements Assessment. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

IsSatisfied.description: A boolean statement of whether the requirement was satisfied or not. A value of "true" indicates that the minimum requirement was satisfied. Note any specific information in the Description.

TypeOfID.description: Brief description of the ID type. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

ResearcherIdentification.description: The value of the researcher ID.

URI.description: The URI (URN or URL) of the of the researcher ID.

Description.description: A description of the purpose and use of the researcher ID. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

EffectivePeriod.description: Clarifies when the identification information is accurate.

ArchiveReference.description: Allows for in-line entry of an Archive related to the creation and maintenance of the ResourcePackage.

TypeOfResource.description: Type of resource used. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: A description of the Resource. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ResourceObjectReference.description: Reference to the resource object used by this development step. If it is an external object create a description as OtherMaterial and reference the OtherMaterial. Use the attribute "objectLanguage" to specify any language preference. Repeat for multiple development objects. TypeOfObject should relate to the object referenced.

ResourceUsage.description: The use of the resource within the DevelopmentProcessingStep. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

MinimumResponses.description: Minimum number of responses accepted expressed and an integer.

MaximumResponses.description: Maximum number of responses accepted expressed and an integer.

ResponseDomain.description: The response domain being used. An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomain.

ResponseDomainReference.description: The inclusion of a response domain by reference (must be supported by a managed representation). An abstract element. May be substituted by any valid object of substitution type ResponseDomainReference.

AttachmentLocation.description: Allows attachment of a secondary response domain to a specific item within another response domain used in the question. For example, attach a TextDomain to the value "Other" using the TextDomain label (Please specify) as a label for the TextDomain.

AttachmentBase.description: If another response domain will be attached to the response domain listed withinResponseDomainInMixed provide a value in attachmentBase to allow for unique identification within this question. AttachmentLocation contains an attribute attachmentDomain which will provide a link from the domain that is being attached to the domain it is being attached to.

SampleSize.description: The size of the sample from whom data was requested.

NumberOfResponses.description: The number of responses within the specified sample.

SpecificResponseRate.description: The specific rate of response expressed as a percent.

Description.description: A description of the rate of response including any information pertinent to understanding the specified rate of response. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ResponseText.description: Text closely related to the content of the ResponseDomain(s), in general, text required to make sense of the related response domain. Note that when using ResponseText, the full ResponseText must be repeated for multi-language versions of the content. Different languages may handle the dynamic portions in different locations and/or with different content. Therefore languages cannot be mixed within a dynamic text except when the full text itself has multiple language sections, for example, a foreign language term in a text. The DisplayText may also be repeated to provide a dynamic and plain text version of the display. This allows for accurate rendering of the ResponseText in a non-dynamic environment like print.

ProcessingInstructionReference.description: Reference to a ProcessingInstruction containing the process instructions for restricting a level of coverage.

CommandCode.description: The process instructions for restricting a level of coverage expressed as a command code.

TypeOfResult.description: Identifies the specific type of result. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: A description of the Results Detail. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ResultsDate.description: The date or date range of obtaining results from the development work.

RequirementsAssessment.description: Description of whether specific requirements for the activities providing these results were met.

Description.description: Description of the role played by the Target Object in relationship to the Source Object.

Keyword.description: Keyword used to classify the role of the organization or individual in relationship to the Source Object

EffectivePeriod.description: Time period when this role is/was valid.

AdditionalInformation.description: Any information not captured by the other descriptive objects. The privacy code may be set to indicate access restriction to this information. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

Label.description: A display label for the Roster. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

ConditionForContinuation.description: Provides the condition for continuing to add another iteration to the Roster. This may be a human readable condition and/or a machine-actionable command.

BaseCodeValue.description: A base value for the first item on the Roster (normally 0 or 1 but can be set to any value especially when the use of a roster extends an enumerated list expressed as an integer.

CodeIterationValue.description: The value added to the last used value to create the iteration value for the current row or column expressed as an integer.

MinimumRequired.description: The minimum number of rows or columns required expressed as an integer.

MaximumAllowed.description: The maximum number of rows or columns allowed expressed as an integer. Leaving this attribute with no value implies that the maximum allowed is unbounded.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

TypeOfSamplingProcedure.description: A generic means of classifying a SamplingProcedure. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: Full description of the sampling procedure. Supports structured content and multiple language content.

SamplingPlanReference.description: Reference to sample plan which describes a process for achieving the sample. TypeOfObject should be SamplingPlan.

SampleReference.description: Reference to sample created using sampling procedure. TypeOfObject should be Sample.

Label.description: A display label for the scale. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

NumberRange.description: Indicates the high and low values (endpoints) of a numeric scale.

Range.description: Indicates the high and low values (endpoints) of a non-numeric scale.

Anchor.description: Allows for the attachment of a category label at any anchor point.

MarkedIncrement.description: Identifies the frequency for increment markers (with or without value attachments).

ValueIncrement.description: Identifies the frequency for value labels on marked or unmarked increments.

DimensionNumber.description: A number used to identify this dimension when describing its intersect point with one or more dimensions in the same scale representation. The dimension is denoted with a 1-based indexing. Dimension in the scale are numbered (1,2,n).

DegreeSlopeFromHorizontal.description: A horizontal line is described as a 0 (zero) slope. Expressed as the number of degrees positive (right end angle above the horizontal line) or degrees positive (right end descending below the horizontal line).

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

ScaleDimension.description: A description of a dimension of the scale. Note that most scales will have only one dimension.

DimensionIntersect.description: Identifies the point at which the scales of a multidimensional scale intersect.

DisplayLayout.description: Defines they layout such as containing a drawn scale line, a list of values only, an outline (the boundaries of the area defined by 2 or more intersecting scales such as a diamond of opposites), or some other layout design. Allows for the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Label.description: A display label for the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

OutParameter.description: Allows for the response to be bound to one of the QuestionItem's OutParameters, so the collected information can be used elsewhere, for example as inputs to subsequent questions in an Instrument or to a GenerationInstruction. If multiple responses are possible, this would represent and ordered array of the responses.

ResponseCardinality.description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this response domain.

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

ScaleDimension.description: A description of a dimension of the scale. Note that most scales will have only one dimension.

DimensionIntersect.description: Identifies the point at which the scales of a multidimensional scale intersect.

DisplayLayout.description: Defines they layout such as containing a drawn scale line, a list of values only, an outline (the boundaries of the area defined by 2 or more intersecting scales such as a diamond of opposites), or some other layout design. Allows for the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Textual.description: Defines the segment of textual content used by the parent object. Can identify a set of lines and or characters used to define the segment.

Audio.description: Describes the type and length of the audio segment.

Video.description: Describes the type and length of the video segment.

XML.description: An X-Pointer expression identifying a node in the XML document.

ImageArea.description: Defines the shape and area of an image used as part of a location representation. The shape is defined as a Rectangle, Circle, or Polygon and Coordinates provides the information required to define it.

Rank.description: The rank value of the dimension for which the selection criteria apply.

AllValues.description: If set to "true" applies to the full set of dimension values. If set to "false" use specificValue, rangeMinimum and rangeMaximum as appropriate to define the subset of values needed.

SpecificValue.description: May contain a single value or a delimited array of values.

RangeMinimum.description: The inclusive minimum value of the range. Use when the values or subset of values are ordered and contiguous and may be expressed as a range.

RangeMaximum.description: The inclusive maximum value of the range. Use when the values or subset of values are ordered and contiguous and may be expressed as a range.

SeriesRepositoryLocation.description: Location of the repository containing the series. This may be repeated for multiple repository locations.

SeriesName.description: The full name of the series. The structure supports the use of multiple language versions of the content. If the name varies depending upon the context or is known by multiple names, this element may be repeated.

SeriesAbbreviation.description: Abbreviation of the series name. Repeat for multiple abbreviations for the SAME series Name.

SeriesDescription.description: Describe the purpose of coverage of the series. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

SimilarConceptReference.description: Reference to a concept with a similar definition.

Difference.description: Description of the difference between the two concepts.  Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

UnitTypeReference.description: Reference to an existing UnitType using the Reference structure. TypeOfObject should be set to UnitType.

NumberOfUnits.description: Indicate the number of units of the UnitType specified.

SoftwareName.description: The name of the software package, including its producer.

SoftwarePackage.description: A coded value from a controlled vocabulary, describing the software package. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (SoftwarePackage) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

SoftwareVersion.description: The version of the software package. Defaults to '1.0'.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the software. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Date.description: Supported date of the software package with, at minimum, a release date if known.

Function.description: Identifies the functions handled by this software. Repeat for multiple functions. It may be advisable to note only those functions used in the specific usage of the software.

Lang.description: Language (human language) of the software package.

OrganizationReference.description: A reference to an Organization described in DDI.

IndividualReference.description: A reference to an Individual described in DDI.

RelationshipCode.description: A specification of the relationship of the Source to the Target in terms of Parent (superior), Child (subordinate), or Sibling (on par).

ManagedRepresentationReference.description: Substitution group head for referencing Managed Representations. For example, ManagedTextRepresentationReference, ManagedNumericRepresentationReference, etc.

CategorySchemeReference.description: A reference to a CategoryScheme as the managed component of a representation.

CodeListReference.description: A reference to a CodeList as the managed component of a representation.

GeographicStructureReference.description: A reference to a GeographicStructure as the managed component of a representation.

GeographicLocationReference.description: A reference to a GeographicLocation as the managed component of a representation.

ConceptReference.description: Reference to a Concept which provides a context for the representation, e.g. Age for a numeric representation.

SourceLinkVariableReference.description: A reference to the variable in the Source Record containing the value that is equal to the value in the identified variable in the Target Record.

TargetLinkVariableReference.description: A reference to the variable in the Target Record containing the value that is equal to the value in the identified variable in the Source Record.

CoordinateValue.description: The value of the coordinate expressed as a string.

CoordinateType.description: Identifies the type of point coordinate system using a controlled vocabulary. Point formats include decimal degree, degrees minutes seconds, decimal minutes, meters, and feet.

ItemSequenceType.description: Identifies the type of sequence to use. Values include InOrderOfAppearance, Random, Rotate, and Other.

AlternateSequenceType.description: Information on the command used to generate an alternative means of determining sequence changes. If used, the ItemSequenceType should be "Other".

AttributeKey.description: This key (sometimes referred to as a name) expressed as a string. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary which is the recommended approach.

AttributeValue.description: The value assigned to the named Key expressed as a string. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

OtherMaterialReference.description: Description and link to the StandardUsed using the DDI Other Material structure.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

StandardWeightValue.description: Provides the standard weight used for weighted analysis of data expressed as an xs:float. This element is referenced by the variable and/or statistics calculated using the standard weight.

PhysicalInstanceReference.description: References a physical instance containing the statistics inline or that identifies the data file which contains the statistics.

IsInline.description: Set to "true" if the summary/category statistics are found inline in the referenced physical instance. Set to "false" if they are in the data file associated with the physical instance.

StatisticalDataLocation.description: Reference to a PhysicalInstance that describes a data file containing the summary and/or category statistics OR contains the statistics in-line as in the case of the same data stored as an ASCII file and as an ORACLE file where the summary and category statistics are listed only in one of the physical instance files.

VariableStatisticsReference.description: One or more statistical measures that describe the responses to a particular variable. Include both variable and category level statistics.

IsWeighted.description: Set to "true" if the statistic is weighted using the weight designated in VariableStatistics.

ComputationBase.description: Defines the cases included in determining the statistic. The options are total=all cases, valid and missing (invalid); validOnly=Only valid values, missing (invalid) are not included in the calculation; missingOnly=Only missing (invalid) cases included in the calculation.

IsWeighted.description: Set to "true" if the statistic is weighted using the weight designated in VariableStatistics.

ComputationBase.description: Defines the cases included in determining the statistic. The options are total=all cases, valid and missing (invalid); validOnly=Only valid values, missing (invalid) are not included in the calculation; missingOnly=Only missing (invalid) cases included in the calculation.

OtherMaterialReference.description: Description and link to the StimulusMaterial using the DDI Other Material structure.

Description.description: A full description of the purpose for stratifying your sample frame prior to sampling

UniverseReference.description: Reference each sub universe which defines a strata of the population. For example if you are stratifying on gender there would be 2 Universe references, one to Males and one to Females.

StratificationRationale.description: Describe the purpose for stratifying your sample frame prior to sampling.

AllocationMethod.description: Method to determine how the sample should be allocated/distributed (Source: US Census Metadata Standard document)

StrataNumber.description: Assign a number to the strata being described

IsTranslated.description: Indicates whether content is a translation (true) or an original (false).

IsTranslatable.description: Indicates whether content is translatable (true) or not (false). An example of something that is not translatable would be a MNEMONIC of an object or a number.

TranslationSourceLanguage.description: List the language or language codes. The language original may or may not be provided in this bundle of language specific strings.

TranslationDate.description: The date the content was translated. Provision of translation date allows user to verify if translation was available during data collection or other time linked activity.

GridResponseDomainInMixed.description: Identifies a response type found in the grid and defines the cell or cells that contain it.

NoDataByDefinition.description: Identifies the cell or cells in the grid that by definition contain no response domains. These cells MAY contain a label.

ResponseTextSet.description: Text closely related to the content of the ResponseDomain(s), in general, text required to make sense of the related response domain. ResponseTextSet provides a means of bundling multiple language versions of ResponseText together. This wrapper serves to differentiate between a case where multiple language content for a single ResponseText are provided and when two differing sets of ResponseText are in immediate sequence (with no intervening question).  Note that when using ResponseText, the full ResponseText must be repeated for multi-language versions of the content within the same ResponseTextSet.

ResponseDomainInMixed.description: A structure that provides both the response domain and information on how it should be attached, or related, to other specified response domains in the question.

Content.description: Supports the optional use of XHTML formatting tags within the string structure. In addition to the language designation and information regarding translation, the attribute isPlain can be set to true to indicate that the content should be treated as plain unstructured text, including any XHTML formatting tags. Repeat the content element to provide multiple language versions of the same content.

Description.description: A description of the purpose in classifying the object and how it conforms to the classification. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ClassType.description: A term used to classify the study class. As these are archive specific, DDI strongly recommends the use of a controlled vocabulary.

TypeOfSummaryStatistic.description: Type of summary statistic, such as count, mean, mode, median, etc. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary. DDI strongly recommends the use of a controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (SummaryStatisticType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

Statistic.description: The value (expressed as a decimal) of the statistics and whether it is weighted and/or includes missing values.

StatisticDouble.description: The value (expressed as a double) of the statistics and whether it is weighted and/or includes missing values.

OrganizationReference.description: A reference to an Organization described in DDI.

IndividualReference.description: A reference to an Individual described in DDI.

Role.description: Describes the role of Target Individual or Organization in relation to the Source Object.

ManagedRepresentationReference.description: Substitution group head for referencing Managed Representations. For example, ManagedTextRepresentationReference, ManagedNumericRepresentationReference, etc.

CategorySchemeReference.description: A reference to a CategoryScheme as the managed component of a representation.

CodeListReference.description: A reference to a CodeList as the managed component of a representation.

CodeSubsetInformation.description: Allows further specification of the codes to use from the CodeList.

IncludedGeographicStructureCodes.description: Identifies the Geographic Structure codes included by the Authorized source of the code, the geographic location being used and the locations to exclude.

IncludedGeographicLocationCodes.description: Identifies the Geographic Location codes included by the Authorized source of the code, the geographic location being used and the locations to exclude.

StrataNumber.description: Indicate specific strata if the sample frame has been stratified prior to sampling within the specified stage.

DesiredSampleSize.description: The number and type of sample units.

SampleSizeFormulaReference.description: Reference to the General or GenerationInstruction containing the formula or instruction used to determine sample size. The basic Reference structure is extended to allow for the use of Binding to link specific source parameters to the InParameter of the instruction at the point of use. If there is a conflict between a Binding in the instruction of a specific source to an InParameter and the Binding information provided in the ProcessingInstructionReference, the Binding information in the reference overrides that found in the instruction. TypeOfObject should be set to GeneralInstruction or GenerationInstruction.

TelephoneNumber.description: The telephone number including country code if appropriate.

TypeOfTelephone.description: Indicates type of telephone number provided (home, fax, office, cell, etc.). Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (TypeOfTelephone) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

EffectivePeriod.description: Clarifies when the identification information is accurate.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

IsPreferred.description: Set to "true" if this is the preferred telephone number for contact.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

ReferenceDate.description: The time period to which the data refer. This item reflects the time period covered by the data, not dates in the life cycle of a study or collection.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

MaxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed.

MinLength.description: The minimum number of characters allowed.

RegExp.description: A regular expression limiting the allowed characters or character order of the content.

Label.description: A display label for the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the domain. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

OutParameter.description: Allows for the response to be bound to one of the QuestionItem's OutParameters, so the collected information can be used elsewhere, for example as inputs to subsequent questions in an Instrument or to a GenerationInstruction. If multiple responses are possible, this would represent and ordered array of the responses.

ResponseCardinality.description: Allows the designation of the minimum and maximum number of responses allowed for this response domain.

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

RecommendedDataType.description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (DataType) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

GenericOutputFormat.description: This field provides a recommended generic treatment of the data for display by an application. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary.

MeasurementUnit.description: Records the measurement unit, for example, 'km', 'miles', etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

MissingValue.description: List the values used to represent missing data. Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred. If this content does not match the values provided in the MissingValuesReference, the content of the MissingValuesReference overrides the content of this attribute.

BlankIsMissingValue.description: When value is true a blank or empty variable content should be treated as a missing value.  Use of MissingValuesReference is preferred.

ClassificationLevelCode.description: Indicates the type of relationship, nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio, or continuous. Use where appropriate for the representation type.

MaxLength.description: The maximum number of characters allowed.

MinLength.description: The minimum number of characters allowed.

RegExp.description: A regular expression limiting the allowed characters or character order of the content.

IsTranslated.description: Indicates whether content is a translation (true) or an original (false).

IsTranslatable.description: Indicates whether content is translatable (true) or not (false). An example of something that is not translatable would be a MNEMONIC of an object or a number.

TranslationSourceLanguage.description: List the language or language codes. The language original may or may not be provided in this bundle of language specific strings.

TranslationDate.description: The date the content was translated. Provision of translation date allows user to verify if translation was available during data collection or other time linked activity.

TextFormat.description: Specifies the format of the text content. Examples: text/plain is preferred, text/html, application/xhtml+xml, etc. see https://www.w3.org/2003/01/xhtml-mimetype/ for additional options. Example of vendor specific: text/vnd.example.markdown

Scope.description: Allows the provision of denoting of named section. Identification of a content sections would be the combination of language and scope, i.e. if more than one section is in English they must have different scope designations.

LineParameter.description: Specification of the line and offset for the beginning and end of the segment.

CharacterParameter.description: Specification of the character offset for the beginning and end of the segment.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

TypeOfTimeMethod.description: Allows brief identification of time method used with the option of using a controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (TimeMethod) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

Description.description: Full description of the data time method used. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

URN.description: The URN of the entity matching the DDI URN pattern associated with the value of the attribute typeOfIdentifier (Canonical or Deprecated).

Agency.description: This is the registered agency code with optional sub-agencies separated by dots.

ID.description: The ID of the object. This must conform to the allowed structure of the DDI Identifier and must be unique within the declared scope of uniqueness (Agency or Maintainable).

Version.description: The version number of the object. For the identifiable object this is the version number of its parent versionable at the point of creation or alteration of the non-administrative metadata of the identifiable. Versionable and Maintainable items increment their version number whenever the non-administrative metadata contained by the object changes.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

Subject.description: A subject or list of subjects that indicate the topical coverage of the data described in a particular module/section. Uses and InternationalCodeValue and may indicate the language of the code used.

Keyword.description: A keyword that indicates the topical coverage of the data described in a particular module/section. Uses and InternationalCodeValue and may indicate the language of the code used.

Column.description: The column identifier expressed as a string.

Row.description: The row number expressed as an integer.

OtherMaterialReference.description: Description and link to the complexType using the DDI Other Material structure.

TypeOfTranslationAid.description: Specifies the type of translation aid available. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: Description of the translation aid. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

TranslationAidResource.description: Provides a reference to the translation aid resource using the structure of OtherMaterial.

TypeOfTranslationMethod.description: Specifies the type of translation method used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Description.description: Description of the translation method. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.
A description of the Translation Requirements. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

IsOral.description: Indicates if the translation is an oral translation.

IsWritten.description: Indicates if the translation is a written translation.

Language.description: Uses the more generic Language element found in a Citation. Allows for use of an external controlled vocabulary.

I18nText.description: Value of the language identifier used.

Description.description: Description of the translation process of the data and metadata. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Lang.description: Language of the tag content.

TranslationSourceLanguageAbility.description: Describes both minimum and preferred language abilities sought for the translation work for the source language.

TranslationTargetLanguageAbility.description: Describes both minimum and preferred language abilities sought for the translation work for the target language.

VariableCategory.description: A structure that is repeated for each category value for which one or more statistics are recorded. Each VariableCategory has one category value and any number of associated statistics.

IsPublic.description: Set to "true" (default value) if this file is publicly available. This does not imply that there are not restrictions to access. Set to "false" if this is not publicly available, such as a backup copy, an internal processing data file, etc.

Privacy.description: A basic set of privacy codes for the parent element. These may be stricter than the general access restrictions for the overall metadata. If available codes are insufficient this may also contain any string.

IsPreferred.description: Set to "true" if this is the preferred URL.

Type.description: Specifies that this URI is a URN. In future, other types of URI may be allowed here.

TypeOfIdentifier.description: Identifies the format of the DDI URN as being canonical or deprecated.

UsageExample.description: Provide relevant illustrations of the use of the weights described produced in the weighting process. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

UsageRestrictions.description: Note specific rules or restrictions for use. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

UsageRecommendations.description: Recommend best practices for the use of the weights described produced in the weighting process. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

CommandCode.description: Use CommandCode content to describe and/or specify code for using weights. Allows specification of input variables using parameters and binding as well description, code snippets or a link to external code.

AlternateName.description: Provides an alternate name for the element, for presentation purposes (not for use in the XML instance). It may be supplied in several language-versions.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the object. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Instructions.description: Instructions for the use of the object within the context of the profile. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DefaultValue.description: This field provides a default value for the specified element or attribute if it holds simple content, and the value must be a valid one per the DDI schemas. This assumes that the value is not specified in the DDI instance itself, which would override the default. The value should also be provided as part of the XPath expression supplied for the field.

IsRequired.description: If true indicates that an element described as optional in DDI is required by the profile.

Xpath.description: Contains an XPath which points to an element or attribute in DDI instances which is used by the profile. All subelements of a used element are assumed to be supported unless explicitly addressed by the profile. The number of supported repetitions may be included in the XPath expression.

LimitMaxOccurs.description: This field allows for limiting the maximum occurrences of this field. If the number is greater than the maxOccurs value in DDI it will be ignored and the DDI specification will remain in use.

FixedValue.description: This field, if set to true, provides an indication that the default value supplied in the fixedValue attribute is the only one which is allowed for the profile - other values will be overridden with the default (a warning should be issued to the creator of the instance); the value must be a valid one per the DDI schemas.

TypeOfUserID.description: This is a required attribute containing the local user identification system that maintains and defines the UserID.

UserIDVersion.description: The UserID may designate the version number of the UserID. This is important in cases where the DDI identification system and the UserID system use different structures to record version numbers or if there is a difference between the DDI version number and the UserID's version number.

TypeOfUserVersion.description: This is the name of the versioning scheme as defined by the user's system, in cases where the user's system employs more than one versioning scheme. It is specific to the system identified by the typeOfUserID attribute

TypeOfVariableAttribute.description: A brief textual identification of the variable attribute type. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

VariableReference.description: A reference to a variable that describes the attribute.

CategoryStatistic.description: The value of a statistic associated with the category value indicated in the sibling CategoryValue element.

VariableReference.description: Reference to the variable associated with the values given.

Value.description: Value associated with the referenced variable in record storage order.

VariableReference.description: References variables in storage order. One reference per variable.

VariableRole.description: Describes a specific function of the variable, such as identity, weight, geographic variable, time, date, currency, etc. This is a more extensive means of identifying the function of the variable than the Boolean indicators on the variable. Allows for agency specific designations. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

WeightVariableReference.description: Reference to one or more weight variables that may be used in analyzing this variable.

StandardWeightReference.description: Reference to the StandardWeight found in the Weighting description, which is relevant for analyzing this variable. A standard weight is a single weight used for all variables of a specific type or for a specified sub-universe.

VariableAttribute.description: An attribute may be any object which should be attached to or coupled with a Variable such as a related suppression flag, source flag, footnote, etc. It may be defined as a Variable or contain textual content (such as a footnote).

ImputationReference.description: Reference to the imputation process described as a General Instruction in a ProcessingInstructionScheme.

ConcatenatedValue.description: Provides a reference to other variables and describes the method for deriving the value of this variable by concatenating a collection of other variables. This is useful in creating concatenated keys.

ProcessingInstructionReference.description: A reference to either a general or generation instruction that was provided to those who converted information from one form to another to create a particular variable. This might include the reordering of numeric information into another form or the conversion of textual information into numeric information. TypeOfObject should be set to GeneralInstruction or GenerationInstruction.

ValueRepresentation.description: Describes the actual representation of the variables' values. Allows for the listing of values to be treated as missing in order to support 3.1 structures. The preferred method is the use of a reference to ManagedMissingValues description using MissingValuesReference. If both are used and there is a conflict in the content, MissingValuesReference will override the content provided in the ValueRepresentationReference.

ValueRepresentationReference.description: Allows for the use of a ManagedRepresentation by reference. ValueRepresentationReference is the abstract head of a substitution group and may be replaced with any valid substitution for ValueRepresentationReference.

MissingValuesReference.description: Reference to an existing MissingValuesRepresentation using the Reference structure. If this content conflicts with content provided in the ValueRepresentation regarding Missing Values. The content of the MissingValuesRepresentation overrides. TypeOfObject will be MissingValuesRepresentation

ContentDateOffset.description: Identifies the difference between the date applied to the data as a whole and this specific item such as previous year's income or residence 5 years ago.

AggregationMethod.description: Indicates the type of aggregation method used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary. The DDI Alliance has provided a controlled vocabulary (AggregationMethod) to support this element at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

Additivity.description: Records type of additivity, such as 'stock', 'flow', 'non-additive'.

VariableItem.description: The set of values associated with a single variable (one for each record in storage order of records).

VariableSchemeReference.description: Reference to a VariableScheme whose members are included in the logical record. Note that individual items may be excluded from the scheme if not used by the logical record.

VariableUsedReference.description: Reference to a variable to include in the logical record. This may be used to supplement the contents of an included VariableScheme or to list all the variables individually.

AllVariablesInLogicalProduct.description: Set to "true" when the logical record contains all the variables identified within the logical product module.

VariableReference.description: Reference to the variable containing the record type locator.

RelatedValue.description: Value of variable indicating this record type, multiple entries allow for multiple valid values or ranges. Indicates if the variable should be equal to, greater than, less than, greater than or equal to, less than or equal to, or not equal to the stated value.(default value is "Equal"). Also allows the conditional value to be defined as blank (or no content).

VersionDistinctionName.description: A name for the Version Distinction. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the Version Distinction. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the Version Distinction. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

EffectivePeriod.description: Clarifies when the identification information is accurate.

RegExp.description: Allows the version structure to be defined by a regular expression.

RationaleDescription.description: Textual description of the rationale/purpose for the version change to inform users as to the extent and implication of the version change. May be expressed in multiple languages.

RationaleCode.description: RationaleCode is primarily for internal processing flags within an organization or system. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

TypeOfVideoClip.description: The type of video clip provided. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

VideoClipBegin.description: The point to begin the video clip. If no point is provided the assumption is that the start point is the beginning of the clip provided.

VideoClipEnd.description: The point to end the video clip. If no point is provided the assumption is that the end point is the end of the clip provided.

Keyword.description: Keywords that describe the vocabulary.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the Vocabulary. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

URI.description: URI to external resource providing information about the vocabulary (general description, main web page).

XMLURI.description: URI to the vocabulary represented as an XML document.

Scheme.description: Textual description of the XML scheme in which the classification is written.

SchemeURI.description: URI to the XML scheme used in the vocabulary (DTD or XML Schema for the XML document above; schemes like DDI, Claset, Neuchatel, and DocBook). Typically, this will be an XML namespace.

Comments.description: Information regarding the selection and usage of the vocabulary including appropriate usage constraints. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

XMLNamespace.description: Specify the namespace which the prefix represents.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

VersionResponsibility.description: Person or organization within the MaintenanceAgency responsible for the version change. If it is important to retain the affiliation between and individual responsible for the version and his/her agency, it may be included in this notation. This is primarily intended for internal use.

VersionResponsibilityReference.description: Reference person or organization within the MaintenanceAgency responsible for the version change, as described in an OrganizationScheme. If it is important to retain the affiliation between and individual responsible for the version and his/her agency, a Relation should be created between the individual referenced here and his/her organization. This is primarily intended for internal use.

VersionRationale.description: Textual description of the rationale/purpose for the version change and a coded value to provide an internal processing flag within and organization or system. Note that versioning can only take place on objects owned by the specified DDI Agency. If you are creating a local instance of an object from another agency for current or future modification use BasedOnObject. If the changes being made result in what you determine to be new object rather than a version of a previous object, i.e. the change is too extensive to consider it a version of the existing object, create a new object and use BasedOnObject to provide a link to the object or objects that were a basis for the new object.

BasedOnObject.description: Use when creating an object that is based on an existing object or objects that are managed by a different agency or when the new object is NOT simply a version change but you wish to maintain a reference to the object that served as a basis for the new object. BasedOnObject may contain references to any number of objects which serve as a basis for this object, a BasedOnRationalDescription of how the content of the referenced object was incorporated or altered, and a BasedOnRationalCode to allow for specific typing of the BasedOnReference according to an external controlled vocabulary.

RelatedOtherMaterialReference.description: The inclusion of an existing OtherMaterial by reference. Use for any type of OtherMaterial not specifically addressed by an inline description for such as ExternalAid in QuestionItem.

VersionDate.description: Date of version using the union set BaseDateType. Duration should not be used in this field, even though allowed by the ISO format enforced by the parser.

IsPublished.description: Indicates that the maintainable will not be changed without versioning, and is a stable target for referencing.

TypeOfApprovalReview.description: A brief identification of the type of approval review such as IRB, ethical, compliance, etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

ReviewObjectReference.description: Reference to an existing identifiable object using the Reference structure.  TypeOfObject should be set to any Versionable or Maintainable object.

AgencyOrganizationReference.description: Reference to an organization or individual, that provided the approval review. TypeOfObject should be set to Organization.

ReviewerRole.description: Role of the reviewing organization or individual. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

ReferenceIdentifier.description: The reference or case identification of the review. Used to specify or track the case by the review organization

Description.description: Description of the approval review which can include requirements for the review, contents, or results.

ApprovalReviewDocumentReference.description: Link to a document related to the ethical review using the OtherMaterial structure.

ApplicationDate.description: Date materials submitted for approval review.

ApprovalDate.description: Date approval received from approval review organization.

ApprovedPeriod.description: Period for which the approval is valid. This may be a start date, and end date, or range specified as a start and end date.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

RelatedOtherMaterialReference.description: The inclusion of an existing OtherMaterial by reference. Use for any type of OtherMaterial not specifically addressed by an inline description for such as ExternalAid in QuestionItem.

VersionDate.description: Date of version using the union set BaseDateType. Duration should not be used in this field, even though allowed by the ISO format enforced by the parser.

IsPublished.description: Indicates that the maintainable will not be changed without versioning, and is a stable target for referencing.

Note.description: Note allows for the attachment of a piece of additional information to any object with an ID. Note facilitates capturing temporary processing notes such as "Review and approval required". A single note can be attached to multiple objects by reference to the objects. Note may also contain content for a needed object that has been reported for addition in a later version of the schema. Ideally this should be handled by a local extension, but Note can accommodate run-time extensions when required. The Note should be housed within the Maintainable object that contains the referenced objects. In this way the user is ensured of receiving all known Note attachments when the maintainable content is delivered. This means that if a Note references objects within multiple Maintainable objects, the Note should be repeated in each Maintainable and reference only those objects with that Maintainable.

Software.description: Indicate the software used to create and/or manage the metadata. This is repeatable to allow for multiple softwares or multiple functions. If this information is important it is advisable to provide it in each maintainable so that it does not become separated from the internal content if the metadata is re-factored.

MetadataQuality.description: An assessment of the quality of the metadata within the Maintainable object, e.g. the quality of the transcription, completeness, editing status, etc.

ExternalReferenceDefaultURI.description: Use to provide a default value for the URI of external references. Use of a URI in a reference within this maintainable overrides the value entered here. Nested maintainables should redeclare the contents of this attribute for clarity.

Lang.description: This is used to designate the language of the metadata content of the maintainable. If a lower level xml:lang attribute conflicts with the content at the maintainable level, the object level value takes precedence.

ArchiveModuleName.description: A name for the Archive module. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the Archive module. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the Archive module. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ArchiveSpecific.description: Contains metadata specific to a particular archive's holding.

OrganizationSchemeReference.description: A list of the organizations related to the DDI instance. This includes information on the archives responsible for creating and maintaining the instance. All agencies must be defined as an Organization in an Archive schema (which can be defined inline or resolved externally).

LifecycleInformation.description: LifecycleInformation contains the description of a set of events in the life cycle of the data. It may be extended by specific users.

UserID.description: Allows for the specification of identifiers other than the specified DDI identification of the object. This may be a legacy ID from DDI-C, a system specific ID such as for a database or registry, or a non-DDI unique identifier. As the identifier is specific to a system the system must be identified with the UserID structure.

UserAttributePair.description: A system specific user defined property of the object expressed as a key/value pair. As this is specific to an individual system the use of controlled vocabularies for the key is strongly recommended.

IsPublished.description: Indicates that the maintainable will not be changed without versioning, and is a stable target for referencing.

CategoryName.description: A name for the category. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the category. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.or of different types or applications.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the category. Note that comparison of categories is done using the content of description. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

ConceptReference.description: Reference to the defining concept.

Generation.description: Describes how the category is derived or generated. A process for describing the determination of category membership.

SubCategoryReference.description: Reference to one or more categories for which the current category is a broader definition. Allows for a reference to the narrower category and the ability to define the relationship as a specialization or part.

IsMissing.description: If the category is describing a classification of "missing data" set the value of isMissing to "true".

TypeOfCategoryGroup.description: A brief textual identification of the CategoryGroup type. Supports the use of an external controlled vocabulary.

CategoryGroupName.description: A name for the CategoryGroup. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Label.description: A display label for the CategoryGroup. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the CategoryGroup. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

DefiningCategoryReference.description: A reference to a category that defines the group, thereby allowing the group to define the contents of that category by explicitly identifying its members.

UniverseReference.description: Reference to the universe statement describing the persons or other objects to which the contents of this group pertain.

ConceptReference.description: Reference to the concept expressed by the objects in this group.

Subject.description: If subjects are listed for this group, it is strongly recommended that the subjects listed also be found in the TopicalCoverage element for the parent packaging element when this group is included directly or by reference in a module containing a coverage element. Use of subject at the group level allows for associating objects as a type of subject based group or to identify subject characteristics of a reusable group of objects.

Keyword.description: If keywords are listed for this group, it is strongly recommended that the keywords listed also be found in the TopicalCoverage element for the parent packaging element when this group is included directly or by reference in a module containing a coverage element. Use of keyword at the group level allows for associating objects as a type of keyword based group or to identify keyword characteristics of a reusable group of objects.

CategoryReference.description: A category defined as a member of this group.

CategoryGroupReference.description: A category group that is a member of this group (nesting structure).

IsOrdered.description: If set to "true" indicates that the content of the group is ordered.

Label.description: A display label for the CategoryScheme. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Description.description: A description of the content and purpose of the CategoryScheme. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

CategorySchemeReference.description: Allows for inclusion by reference of other category schemes.

CategoryReference.description: A description of a particular category or response. OECD Glossary of Statistical Terms: Generic term for items at any level within a classification, typically tabulation categories, sections, subsections, divisions, subdivisions, groups, subgroups, classes and subclasses.

CategoryGroupReference.description: Allows categories to be grouped with or without hierarchical structure.
